items.title: Why it took police nine days to declare the Invasion Day attempted bomb attack in Perth terrorism

items.title: Perth council in 'respectful' disagreement over spending choices on meals and rent
items.summary: A newly elected councillor in the Shire of Serpentine-Jarrahdale, in Perth's outer-eastern fringe, accuses the shire of making poor spending choices with ratepayers' money.

items.title: Josh Hazlewood out of T20 World Cup with injury in another blow to Australia's hopes
items.summary: Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of Australia's T20 World Cup campaign as he continues to recover from the injuries which kept him from playing in the summer's Ashes series.

items.title: Bullock says government spending not sole factor pushing inflation higher as political fight heats up
items.summary: RBA governor Michele Bullock has refused to blame the Albanese government for rising inflation, as a political fight breaks out in the wake of the bank's rate hike.

items.title: RecipeTin Eats' Nagi Maehashi is normalising taking time off for pets. Here's why that matters.
items.summary: Experts say our pets have become such an important part of our lives that it's important to take a step back from responsibilities, if possible, when they are sick or dying.

items.title: Inside Ryan Wesley Routh's plan to kill Donald Trump and 'up-end American democracy'
items.summary: As Donald Trump arrived at a golf course in September 2024, a would-be assassin had already been lying in wait for almost 12 hours.

items.title: Queensland's free influenza vaccine program to return this year with nasal spray for children aged two to five
items.summary: The program — which will run from March to September — will provide free flu vaccinations, including a nasal spray option for children aged two to five years.

items.title: Nancy Guthrie and siblings' video response to mother's abduction
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: WA author Craig Silvey has child exploitation bail conditions altered after complaining of media attention
items.summary: WA children's author Craig Silvey gets his bail conditions altered by a Perth court after complaining of "significant media attention" since being charged with child exploitation offences.

items.title: Premier Chris Minns says Newcastle Writers Festival 'crazy' to invite author Randa Abdel-Fattah
items.summary: The festival's director said Dr Abdel-Fattah was invited in August last year and denied the state government pressured her to remove the writer.

items.title: Brodie Jake Dewar faces upgraded charge of manslaughter after Labor identity Tim Picton's death
items.summary: The man accused of a one-punch attack on former Labor strategist Tim Picton, who died in hospital last month, has his charge upgraded to manslaughter.

items.title: Police investigating after unique Pokemon cards stolen from Canberra store
items.summary: The owner of Collectors Colloseum in Canberra says he believes about $150,000 worth of trading cards was stolen overnight.

items.title: Minneapolis man Kyle Wagner charged with threatening and cyberstalking ICE officers
items.summary: A 37-year-old activist has been arrested for what the US Justice Department says is cyberstalking and threatening to kill or assault ICE officers involved in the crackdown in Minnesota.

items.title: Indonesia's government directs education funds to meals program as teachers struggle on low wages
items.summary: Temporary teachers in Indonesia paid low wages criticise a government decision to direct one third of yearly education funding to the president's flagship free meals program.

items.title: The easiest way to clean your microwave and a common mistake to avoid
items.summary: When was the last time you cleaned your microwave? According to experts, it's actually a lot simpler than cleaning other appliances.

items.title: Australia's surging expectations at the Winter Olympics come thanks to Geoff Henke's strident advocacy
items.summary: Australia is hoping Milano Cortina 2026 will be its most successful Winter Olympics in history. The reason for Australia's winter sports surge has its roots in a 70-year-old snubbing.

items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: No sign of Dezi Freeman as latest search ends in Mount Buffalo National Park
items.summary: Detectives say they will not give up on finding Victorian fugitive Dezi Freeman, accused of killing two police officers and injuring a third.

items.title: French authorities sink tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, then release suspects
items.summary: French authorities intercept a ship carrying five tonnes of cocaine bound for Australia, before releasing the vessel and its crew.

items.title: NSW Liberal leader Kellie Sloane talks Chris Minns, polls, slogan bans and Bondi
items.summary: The leader of the NSW opposition says the trait behind Premier Chris Minns's popularity is also his greatest weakness, declaring the Coalition is "absolutely in the game" to win next year's state election.

items.title: Plenty of barramundi expected to be caught this year after Queensland's wild weather
items.summary: Commercial fishers are hopeful for an abundance of barramundi after heavy rainfall from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji on the east coast and ongoing flooding in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

items.title: Grandmother removed from Toowoomba birth suite by security
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Man shot dead by police after suspected domestic-related stabbing on NSW Mid North Coast
items.summary: Police say a man shot dead by an officer was armed with a knife and chainsaw when he stabbed a woman during an earlier assault in Tuncurry.

items.title: Questions raised over $93 million investment in WA school with 30 per cent attendance rate
items.summary: By the end of 2026 the WA government and Woodside will have spent over $93 million on Roebourne District High School and its 141 enrolled students. But last year only one in four upper school students attended.

items.title: Beyond the Songs Inside: After the applause
items.summary: Creative prison programs are celebrated for their ability to heal and transform incarcerated people. But are they enough to break the cycle?

items.title: Two people charged over domestic violence murder
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Demersal fishing reforms drive fish and chip price rise on WA's south coast
items.summary: The two-time winner of Australia's Best Takeaway Fish and Chips says it has been forced to increase prices considerably following Western Australia's demersal fishing reforms.

items.title: Magnetic fields, psychedelics and ketamine helping to treat the brain
items.summary: A Queensland not-for-profit mental health clinic that delivers novel therapies such as ketamine and psilocybin is expanding its services.

items.title: ABC reporter and newsreader Nick McLaren looks back on three decades of reporting in Wollongong
items.summary: ABC journalist Nick McLaren reflects on three decades of change and rebirth in the steel city of Wollongong.

items.title: Pharmacy apologises after customers given wrong medicines, scripts in Broome
items.summary: More than a dozen customers have come forward over concerns two Broome chemists have handed out the wrong medications.

items.title: What time is the Super Bowl? Here's what to know about American football's biggest game
items.summary: Here is everything you need to know about the Super Bowl, including when it will start, how to watch, and who you will see on the stage at half-time.

items.title: WA Premier Roger Cook writes letter to 13yo hero swimmer Austin Appelbee
items.summary: Premier Roger Cook writes to the 13-year-old, who made international headlines after swimming 4 kilometres in rough seas to raise the alarm and save his family.

items.title: Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis defends controversial Perth and WA demersal fishing ban
items.summary: A "judgement call" about a permanent commercial fishing ban for demersal species went further than the advice handed to her, WA's Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis says.

items.title: Man flown to hospital with burns after assault at Bacchus Marsh property
items.summary: Detectives from the Arson and Explosives Squad are investigating an assault that left a man critically injured with burns at Bacchus Marsh.

items.title: Nationals counter Ley's offer with two-week frontbench exile — as it happened
items.summary: The Nationals have proposed spending another two weeks in exile from the frontbench rather than address the Liberals' non-negotiable conditions for a Coalition reunion.

items.title: ASX suffers worst day in almost a year in 'panic' sell-off — as it happened
items.summary: Nearly $70 billion has been wiped off the Australian share market in its worst trading session since the "Liberation Day" sell-off in April 2025. See how the day unfolded and read insights from our business reporters on the ABC News markets blog.

items.title: Voters in David Littleproud's seat of Maranoa weigh in amid Coalition split, One Nation surge
items.summary: As One Nation announces its plan to open an office in Longreach, the ABC speaks to voters in David Littleproud's electorate to get their thoughts on the Nationals leader.

items.title: Late NSW tradie Brett Mckay connected with thousands by sharing cancer battle online
items.summary: When NSW tradie Brett Mckay started sharing videos of his cancer journey with his mates on social media, he did not expect thousands of strangers to come along for the ride.

items.title: Savannah Guthrie's missing mother is 'still out there', police say, but no suspects
items.summary: US investigators believe the missing mother of Today show host Savannah Guthrie is "still out there" despite having no proof she is still alive.

items.title: Karnivool's new album In Verses was worth the 13-year wait, bagpipes and all
items.summary: They're one of Australia's most revered heavy acts. And arguably the most patient. Karnivool unpack the 13-year journey to their new album, In Verses.

items.title: ATO debt continues to drive record level of calls to small business financial helpline
items.summary: Financial counsellors say small businesses struggling to pay debts owed to the tax office are driving calls to Australia's Small Business Debt Helpline higher.

items.title: What Israel's President Isaac Herzog has said about Gaza, and why he won't be arrested in Australia
items.summary: When Israel's president lands in Australia this weekend, he can expect an official red carpet treatment. But he will be all too aware of the controversy his visit is generating.

items.title: State coroner recommends NSW government adopt Escape. Hide. Tell awareness campaign
items.summary: The recommendation was one of 23 handed down on Thursday as part of the Bondi Junction stabbing inquest findings.

items.title: US hopes to challenge China's critical minerals dominance with new trading bloc
items.summary: The US is urging dozens of countries to follow Australia's lead and sign on to a plan to stop relying on China for the critical minerals used in modern technology.

items.title: Jim Chalmers's appetite for economic reform is about to be tested
items.summary: Jim Chalmers could face his biggest test yet as treasurer over the next few months.

items.title: Effect of capital gains tax changes on housing affordability likely depends on design
items.summary: Labor has not ruled out changes to the capital gains tax discount but wants any tax changes to improve housing affordability.

items.title: Former attorney-general Mark Dreyfus warned anti-corruption chief to 'manage' or 'avoid' conflicts
items.summary: A letter from Mark Dreyfus to Paul Brereton provides new insight into the expectations set for the inaugural chief of the anti-corruption watchdog.

items.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese signs security treaty with Indonesia
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has travelled to Jakarta to sign the treaty, which the Australian government calls the "biggest step" the countries have taken together in 30 years.

items.title: Today in history, February 6: The Manchester United team that perished in the Munich air disaster of 1958
items.summary: On a snowy February afternoon in 1958, the football team that many were calling the greatest that Britain had ever produced stopped to refuel at Munich Airport. The plane would never take off, and the Flowers of Manchester would take years to bloom again.

items.title: Positive spin from Liberal leader as retiring MP Sam Groth forces Nepean by-election
items.summary: When retiring first-term Liberal Sam Groth told his leader he was quitting politics, forcing a by-election, Jess Wilson didn't try to talk him out of it.

items.title: Epstein files reveal the men who looked away after women had spoken up
items.summary: The millions of pages of documents related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have shone a light on how many influential men were ready to disregard the experiences of countless women.

items.title: New study reveals how stressful footy fandom can be
items.summary: A new study reveals how much high-stakes sporting events can get the heart pumping by strapping trackers to over 200 German football fans.

items.title: Keir Starmer apologises to Epstein's victims for appointing Lord Mandelson as ambassador to US
items.summary: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer says former ambassador to the US Peter Mandelson lied when asked about the nature of his relationship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

items.title: Diamonds defeat Jamaica in first netball Test match in Adelaide
items.summary: The Diamonds made a flying start with the initial six goals in a comprehensive 72-41 victory at the Adelaide Entertainment Centre.

items.title: Bondi Junction inquest saw recommendation for supported housing for homeless, some are already benefitting
items.summary: An inquest into the Bondi Junction stabbing has recommended that the NSW government support long-term accommodation for homeless people experiencing mental health issues. It's a model that is already finding success.

items.title: Victoria and Queensland lose 17 wickets on day one of MCG Sheffield Shield game
items.summary: After the two-day Ashes Test raised eyebrows over the MCG pitch, Queensland and Victoria are on track for another swift finish after 17 wickets on day one of their Sheffield Shield clash.

items.title: Thursday Finance with David Chau
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Coroner recommends Ambulance Victoria guideline review following nut allergy death of Max McKenzie
items.summary: The coroner could not definitively rule that the anaphylaxis death of 15-year-old Max McKenzie was preventable, despite identifying delays in the teen's medical treatment.

items.title: Union urges Sanjeev Gupta to sell Tahmoor mine as $350m offer revealed
items.summary: The Mining and Energy Union says a firm $350 million offer is on the table to restart Tahmoor Colliery, warning delays risk the mine's future and hundreds of jobs.

items.title: How capital gains tax changes could impact you
items.summary: According to a well-sourced leak, changes to capital gains tax discounts could form the centrepiece of the next federal budget in May. And while the government has downplayed the idea, it has not been ruled out.

items.title: Albanese, Ley condemn alleged act of terror targeting Indigenous protesters
items.summary: The prime minister and opposition leader have both condemned the alleged attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally more than a week ago, after police revealed it was being prosecuted as a terror incident.

items.title: NSW government contacts Newcastle Writers Festival about author Randa Abdel-Fattah's inclusion
items.summary: The NSW government makes contact with the board of next month's Newcastle Writers Festival about the inclusion of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, the ABC understands.

items.title: Murray-Darling Basin Authority hands down discussion paper ahead of first review in 14 years
items.summary: The Murray-Darling Basin Authority says the basin plan has delivered real benefits, but climate change, disconnected floodplains and poor water quality mean things still need to change.

items.title: Bunnings wins fight to use AI facial recognition tech to combat store crime, opening door for other retailers
items.summary: Bunnings was reasonably entitled to use AI facial recognition technology to combat crime and staff abuse in its stores, the Administrative Review Tribunal finds.

items.title: Lockhart River Mayor Wayne William Butcher pleads guilty to Cairns bail breach
items.summary: A Far North Queensland mayor has pleaded guilty to two counts of breaching his bail conditions after he was found drinking tea in a casino with a person he must avoid.
